runs.comm: floats it wide outside off, the batsman watches it go through to the keeper
flatter and quicker on the stumps, the batsman punches it down to long on for first runs
he stays back and tucks the flatter delivery to deep midwicket for a single
fuller on off, driven in the air, almost back to the bowler.. Some oohs and aahs after that
comes forward and pushes the flat delivery straight to cover
here comes the first boundary! Not exactly where he wanted it from though. He looks to cut and gets thick outside edge
short of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it off the back foot
wonderfully timed through cover! The batsman goes down on his knees and crunches the fuller delivery to the off side, but there is protection in the deep
comes forward and punches the length delivery straight to cover
no movement of the feet, he tries to heave this length delivery over the on side and is lucky that it goes over the stumps after he had missed it
that is some punchy stroke! Only a hint of width and the batsman wallops it through backward point, all along the ground
comes forward and punches the length delivery firmly to mid-off
good tight delivery on off stump, the batsman steers it through backward point and comes back for a quick second
on the pads, this time he picks up another couple to the other side, whipped to deep backward square leg
this is in the air but in the gap too! He didn't look entirely in control as he played at this a touch early, but it went through wide mid-on and races to the boundary
nothing wrong about this one! This is a length ball and that has been chipped straight over the bowler's head. The timing in that carries it all the way. Superb effort
he looks to turn the length delivery on the leg side but gets an outside edge to gully
length delivery outside off, the batsman pushes it straight to point
back of length delivery on off, the batsman nudges it to backward point off the back foot for a single

that's the first strike for Netherlands! Poor shot by Stirling as the team was progressing rather well. He tries to throw his bat at a short of length delivery but gets a thick top edge that settles into the hands of the point fielder
this is a sumptuous drive from the captain! Just leans into this length delivery and pushes it through extra cover, the timing takes it through to the boundary. Seemed like just a push
stays in the crease and defends the length delivery to midwicket
another one through covers! Porterfield is looking in good nick. Nothing wrong with the delivery again, it's just a length delivery and the batsman caresses it through the gap
back of length now, the batsman defends it to point
tossed up delivery on off, driven straight to cover
he looks for a gap in the cover area, but can't find one. Punched straight to the fielder again
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman nudges this to the gap at cover with soft hands for a single
whoaa! He just moves to the leg side to give himself some room and slaps it over long off with ridiculous ease! How did that travel so far?
looks to chop this one through the off side, but gets a bottom edge
comes forward and punches the length delivery straight to cover
he serves a fuller delivery to Joyce, who drives it straight to the cover fielder
a loose shot outside off! the batsman sees the width and tries to crash it through point without getting close to the line, is beaten
back of length delivery on off, the batsman waits and pulls it over midwicket for a single to the fielder in the deep

this is such a teaser! The batsman flicks it to the right of short fine leg fielder. Van de Gugten could have stopped it straightaway as it was not very far, but he chooses to run along and looses the race
he is in some form! Gets a fuller delivery and thumps it on the up to cover, but finds the fielder this time
slower delivery on the stumps, the batsman waits and tries to run it down to third man, but hits it straight to point

it's a drop! Joyce must have had his heart in the mouth, he skipped down the track and chipped it straight to long on, but the fielder - Ahsan Malik - doesn't get down in time.. He gets a hand, but can't hang on
pushed through on the pads, it's punched down to long on for a single
moves away to the leg side and punches this delivery to deep cover
drives this one on the up to the cover and the fielder is not able to stop it cleanly, allows a single
this is smartly chipped over extra cover! Again, what timing from the batsman.. Looked like a mere push, but it lands just a couple of meters inside the rope
length delivery on the pads, that is worked away to deep midwicket for a single
he waits in the crease and punches it to wide long on off the back foot
he comes down the pitch and makes room too, drives the full delivery through extra cover for another single
on the pads, neatly clipped to deep square leg for an easy single
loud appeal for lbw as the batsman misses his flick, but that pitched outside leg. The batsmen take a leg bye to backward point
loses direction and bowls this well down the leg side
length delivery on off stump, the batsman pushes it on the up straight to cover
flighted and full on the pads, it's nudged softly through square leg for a quick couple
comes down the pitch and punches the flighted delivery to deep midwicket
stays in the crease and pushes the length delivery to deep midwicket again
takes a step down the pitch and calmly pushes the flatter delivery to long on

he was in some trouble here! Porterfield goes for a reverse sweep, misses it as it sneaks under his bat and he had no idea where it went. It was in the keeper's gloves and he took out the leg stump. Luckily for the batsman, he kept his back leg inside the crease
allows the ball to turn in, then clips it to deep midwicket for a single

What have you done Porterfied! Three short of his fifty, the captain decides to go for a cross-batted heave after advancing down the pitch.. But that probably came slower than he anticipated, it slides under his bat and knocks the off stump back
length delivery on off, he takes a single down to long off
allows the back of length delivery to come to him, defends it to cover
slow off the pitch again, the batsman has to wait a bit before he whips it down to long on from outside off
this one is actually a slower delivery, the batsman plays his flick too early and gets hit high on the pad

this could have been close! The batsman looks to push the slower offcutter to the off side, but gets an inside edge that lobs off his pads to the leg side.. Borren ran in, but couldn't quite make it in time
he comes down the pitch and gets a juicy high full toss, no problems in hammering that over deep square leg with a heavy swing of the bat
waits on the back foot and punches this flatter delivery to deep cover
tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover

tossed up and full, the batsman drives it straight down the pitch. The bowler doesn't stop it cleanly which allows a single. Possibly a chance too. That was in the air and had the bowler got down in time, it could have been curtains for Poynter
flatter and lower this time, the batsman pushes it straight to cover
comes down the pitch and takes the flighted delivery on the full, punches it to long on
flatter and quicker from Swart, the batsman pushes it through cover

this one is definitely a drop! the batsman punched this full delivery straight back at the bowler, that was hit hard and high and Swart is not able to hold on. The umpire was falling to his right to avoid that too
comes forward and punches this to deep cover for a single
full and flighted, the batsman flicks it to deep midwicket
almost in the blockhole, the batsman digs it out to long on
bowls it full and bowls it on off stump, the batsman punches it past the bowler's left.. That was not too far from the bowler
short of length delivery, he pulls it to long on without much timing

that was too cheeky and a bit unnecessary! Joyce maybe gone here. The bowler tried to create room, the bowler followed him and hit his pads, the ball dropped close to the stumps. Can't see a run in that. But Joyce calls the striker anyway. The keeper does well to comes in and hit the stumps at close range
he punches the first ball down to long on to pick up his first runs

another single close to the stumps as the batsman chops the ball.. This time though the batsmen are quicker and make it through. The keeper fires a throw at the non-striker's end, but the batsmen were alert and take a single of the ricochet
on the pads, this one is flicked easily to fine leg for a single
poor first delivery, this is a full toss down the leg side and the batsman just helps it on its way, flicking it  all the way to the boundary.. It hits the rope flush on the skirting
this one is on the pads too, pushed to deep square leg
short ball on the middle and leg, poor again from Borren. He doesn't have the pace to scare anyone. The batsman just smacks it to deep backward square leg boundary
on the pads, this is easily worked away to deep square leg for a single
a good slower delivery from the Borren, it beats the batsman's attempted heave
on the pads again, easily flicked fine on the leg side for a single
it's on the pads and the batsman misses his flick. the ball grazes the pads on way to the keeper
this was actually a very good delivery, a yorker outside off. The batsman though just squeezes it out towards off and beats the fielder at short third man
moves to the off side and whips the length delivery down to fine leg
that's in the arc and it's out of the park! Walloped over long on with utter ease..
a low full toss on off, the batsman digs it out towards cover for a single
another good delivery, in the blockhole. The batsman pushes it to long on for a single
he makes room and looks to heave it on the on side, but gets some inside edge behind square
fuller and flatter, darted in towards the leg stump, the batsman punches it down to long on
Poynter gets the length to get under! It's a half-volley and the batsman whacks it over deep midwicket for a big one
make that two in two! Same ball, same shot! Poynter has enough muscle to smack these over and over again
that's a hat-trick of sixes here! But this is the best of the lot. It's full outside off and Poynter plays an inside out drive that keeps defying gravity till it crosses the ropes
full on the pads, the batsman whips it to deep midwicket for a single
full toss on the pads, Poynted is rocketing towards his fifty..He whips it neatly into the gap at deep square leg. The fielder put in the dive, but the batsman could have frankly played it anywhere
Poynter, Poynter! He gets another juicy full toss and picks his spot beautifully.. A boundary in the same area again..
he gets to his half-century with a soft push to cover.. He has taken just 27 balls to get there, first one for him. What an effort this has been! Silent. Effective
he tries to launch this over cover but misses the length delivery completely
a low full toss outside off, the batsman hits it to wide long-off from the toe of his bat, the lack of timing allowing them to come back for a second

whoaaa! Now KOB joins in. vd Gugten commits the mistake of serving up a length delivery outside off and the batsman flexes his muscles, launching this up, up and away .. over extra cover for a huge hit
this one doesn't get up much after pitching on length, slides under the batsman's swing
comes down the pitch and punches the length delivery to long off
full toss on the pads, KOB flicks it straight to fine leg..

dropped by the bowler! Well, this was a difficult chance high to his right! He beat the batsman with the slower delivery, and the batsman's slow shot beat the bowler's timing of the jump.. He got a hand but couldn't hold on
fuller on off, the batsman digs it out to cover
comes down the pitch, but gets beaten as this cuts in to the batsman, hits him on the body.. Poynter calls for a quick single anyway
wow! how? This if a low full toss outside off and the batsman slices it over point.. all the way for a six.. how easy it can be
this is not a driving range! But it doesn't matter for KOB, who murders a full toss way way over the long on boundary..
slower bouncer from the bowler, the batsman can only drag it as far as short fine leg
finally a good yorker! It's wide outside off and skids under the bat
full delivery on off, punched straight to extra cover

wonderful shot this one! KOB was making room by moving to the leg side, but the bowler delivery this full and wide outside off and he had to stretch to reach it. He not only manages to get some bat on it, gets enough to power it over point

he could have been run out twice! First the bowler misses the throw as Poynter gives up after taking a few steps down the pitch.. The keeper then gathers the throw and he too, misses.. Poynter can't believe his luck
a good offcutter from round the stumps, the batsman gets hit on the thigh pad but takes a single
he was standing way outside the leg stump! Takes the delivery on the full and punches it to deep midwicket
another good cutter! This one beats the batsman's waft towards leg side, but hit the thigh pad and is deflected fine to the off side.. a boundary again..

another one! This brings up the century of the partnership as well! The batsman gets it off the middle as he whacks it to deep midwicket.. The fielder dives forward, but is not able to get under it.. It slides to the boundary
he looks for the same area at deep midwicket but holes out this time, taken easily by the fielder
